newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Five police killed in northern Philippine ambush.
newsitem.headline: Five police killed in northern Philippine ambush.

text.p: Five policemen, including a local police chief, were killed in an ambush by armed men in the northern Philippines, a report reaching the police regional headquarters on Friday said.

The report said Police Inspector Manuel Alop, Palauig town's chief of police, and four other policemen were fired at by still unidentified men on Wednesday afternoon along a dirt road in Zambales province, 140 km (87 miles) north of Manila.
Two civilians, who were hitching a ride inside the police jeep, were also killed in the ambush.
The policemen were on their way to investigate a crime.
Police investigators said they believed the ambush was the work of local communist rebels. But no one so far has claimed responsibility for the attack.

The Philippine government is holding peace negotiations with the leaders of the local communist party in Utrecht in the Netherlands to end the 28-year insurgency. The peace talks will resume next month.
